title: Behavior of function from graph of derivative

content.question: The graph of f', the derivative of the function f, is shown above. Which of the following could be the graph of f ?

choices.label: Each option shows 2 curves in the x y plane. There are 4 evenly spaced tick marks on each side of the origin on each axis. The first tickmark to the right of the origin, and the first tickmark above the origin, are each labeled one.  (A)  One curve is in the second and third quadrants only. From left to right, the curve begins at a point near the coordinates negative 4 comma negative 4 point five. The curve moves gradually up and to the right, passing through the x axis between x equals negative 2 and x equals negative 3, and continuing up and to the right. The curve ends at a point near the y axis above y equals 4.   A second curve is in the first and fourth quadrants only. The curve appears almost vertical near the y axis below y equals negative 4. The curve moves steeply up, intersecting the x axis at a point between the origin and x equals one, and continues up until it reaches a point near the coordinates one comma 1 point five. Then the curve bends sharply down, intersecting the x axis just to the right of x equals 2, before ending near the coordinates 4 comma negative 4 point five.

One curve is in the second and third quadrants only. From left to right, the curve begins near the coordinates negative 4 point five comma 4 point five and moves gradually down and to the right, passing through the x axis at x equals negative 2. The curve continues down and to the right until it is near the coordinates negative zero point five comma negative one point five, where it bends steeply down and to the right, appearing almost vertical until it ends near the y axis below y equals negative 4. A second curve is in the first quadrant only. The curve appears almost vertical near the y axis above y equals 4. The curve moves steeply down and to the right, until it reaches a point near one comma one point five. Then the curve bends sharply up and continues up until it reaches a point near the coordinates 3 comma 4 point five.

One curve is in the second and third quadrants only. From left to right, the curve begins at a point near the coordinates negative 4 comma 4 point five. The curve moves gradually down and to the right, passing through the x axis between x equals negative 2 and x equals negative 3, and continuing down and to the right. The curve ends at a point near the y axis below y equals negative 4. A second curve is in the fourth quadrant only. The curve appears almost vertical near the y axis below y equals negative 4. The curve moves steeply up and to the right, until it reaches a point near the coordinates one comma negative one. Then the curve bends down and continues down until it reaches a point near the coordinates 4 point five comma negative two.

One curve is in the second and third quadrants only. From left to right, the curve begins at a point near the coordinates negative 3 comma negative 4 point five. The curve moves gradually up and to the right, passing through the x axis just to the left of x equals negative one.The curve continues steeply up and to the right, appearing almost vertical near the y axis above y equals 4.    A second curve is in the first and fourth quadrants only.  The curve appears almost vertical near the y axis above y equals 4. The curve moves steeply down and to the right before becoming almost horizontal near the x axis. The curve passes through the tickmark labeled one on the x axis. The curve continues down and to the right, and ends at a point near the coordinates 4 point five comma negative 4 point five.

content.answer: Each option shows 2 curves in the x y plane. There are 4 evenly spaced tick marks on each side of the origin on each axis. The first tickmark to the right of the origin, and the first tickmark above the origin, are each labeled one.  (A)  One curve is in the second and third quadrants only. From left to right, the curve begins at a point near the coordinates negative 4 comma negative 4 point five. The curve moves gradually up and to the right, passing through the x axis between x equals negative 2 and x equals negative 3, and continuing up and to the right. The curve ends at a point near the y axis above y equals 4.   A second curve is in the first and fourth quadrants only. The curve appears almost vertical near the y axis below y equals negative 4. The curve moves steeply up, intersecting the x axis at a point between the origin and x equals one, and continues up until it reaches a point near the coordinates one comma 1 point five. Then the curve bends sharply down, intersecting the x axis just to the right of x equals 2, before ending near the coordinates 4 comma negative 4 point five.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
